meanings.sent1: She accidentally ruckled the paper while folding it.
meanings.sent2: The old map started ruckling at the edges from being handled so much.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy ruckled the blanket as he tried to make a cozy nest.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to ruckle the once smooth surface of the pond, creating a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent5: The wind's force was so strong that it could ruckle even the sturdiest fabric.
meanings.sent6: After the cat jumped on the bed, it caused the sheets to ruckle up.
meanings.sent7: The chef's hands would often ruckle the dough as he kneaded it.
meanings.sent8: The little girl's laughter would always ruckle her nose, making her look even more adorable.
meanings.sent9: The intense heat began to ruckle the paint on the old wooden door.
meanings.sent10: The rough waves would ruckle the sand on the shore, leaving interesting patterns behind.

meanings.sent1: She smoothed out the ruckling in the fabric before sewing it.
meanings.sent2: The tailor carefully ironed out the ruckling in the dress.
meanings.sent3: The ruckling in the paper made it look like a tiny mountain range.
meanings.sent4: The old book's pages showed signs of ruckling from years of use.
meanings.sent5: The ruckling on the baby's forehead when she frowned was adorable.
meanings.sent6: The artist added a touch of paint to highlight the ruckling in the tree bark.
meanings.sent7: The ruckling on the old man's face told stories of a life well-lived.
meanings.sent8: The ruckling on the flower petals gave them a unique texture.
meanings.sent9: The ruckling on the map made it look like a treasure map waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent10: The ruckling on the puppy's ears made him even cuter.
